Job.Title: Workshop Manager | Heavy fabrication | Perth
Job.Summary: Proven leadership and heavy fabrication savvy candidate required.
Job.Description:
About the company

Australian owned heavy fabrication and construction.
  
About the role
Reporting to the MD and GM, you are responsible for the overall production and output of a major heavy industrial workshop, specializing in structural steel fabrication, mineral processing, and mine site installations valued at 500k - $ 50m. A key to the role is prioritizing and planning projects whilst  'looking ahead' and seeing the bigger picture. Also your management of established key personnel and gaining their buy-in, which in turn will have a positive effect on production and output.  Ideally, you will be from an engineering background as you’ll need to draw on your technical knowledge and planning skills 

Key duties
  • Responsible for production, QA, and HSE across all workshop(s)
  • Prioritizing and planning projects which will impact production.
  • The ability to ‘look ahead’ – Utilizing resources
  • Man-management and internal stakeholder engagement.
  • Technical/engineering understanding
  • Liaising with senior management on cost, manpower, and production
Skills and experience
  • Strong leadership and man-management within the heavy industry;
  • Technically proficient across large and complex heavy engineering projects;
  • Able to implement change and gain respect within workforces;
  • Influence and engage a varying number of stakeholders;
  • Experience in the delivery of large scale mining, rail, and commercial projects- Workshop & Site.
 
Culture

This private company prides itself on its commitment to people. They support and encourage. This company has a strong commitment to its culture and operations.

Benefits 
  • An engaging and flexible management team
  • Career growth & opportunity
  • Engage and work on iconic projects
  • Perth based – NO FIFO
Please submit your full CV (ideally in WORD) - In full confidence - Quoting: 919364
  
Note: Only successful candidates will be shortlisted and contacted.
  
For an initial discussion, feel free to call Paul on Perth 08 9215 6200  WST

Job.Title: Excavator / Bobcat Operator - Demolition
Job.Summary: Excavator / Bobcat Operator with demolition experience required. Full time permanent position
Job.Description:
Our client provides demolitions  services for large construction projects and requires an experience Excavator / Bobcat Operator.
 
The suitable applicant will have a minimum of 3 years experience operating an Excavator and Bobcat in a demolition role and will have an unrestricted HR licence. 
 
Requirements:
  • White Card
  • Open HR Truck License
  • Competence ticket
  • Good attitude
  • Team player  
You will also need to hold any appropriate Nationally Accredited High Risk licences.
 
Successful candidates will be required to pass a full pre-employment medical including a drug and alcohol screen, have a proven ability to adhere to safety regulations and previous industry experience.
 
If you are interested in this opportunity, or would like to express your interest for future opportunities, please contact Crest by applying to the job.

Job.Title: Forklift Operator Labourer
Job.Summary: Labourer / Forklift Operator required for business Kewdale business.
Job.Description:
Our client, based in Kewdale is currently seeking an enthusiastic Labourer with a forklift ticket for their production facility. 

This position will start as a casual role with the opportunity for permanent employment in the future.

Requirements:
  • Current LF License and ability to operate in a high paced environment
  • Current Drivers License and reliable transport
  • Previous manufacturing experience
  • Great 'Can Do' attitude.
  • Strong OHS principals
  • Available to start ASAP
If you meet the requirements and are interested in the position please select 'Apply Now" below to send through your resume

Job.Title: Bid Co-ordinator | Marketing and development | Perth
Job.Summary: Are you an experienced Bid co-coordinator who likes engaging with clients ? Then step out of the shadows and read on...........
Job.Description:
About the company

Our client is a multi-disciplinary company with a proven track record in delivering small to large-scale mine site construction, maintenance and operations in Australia.

About the role

Reporting directly to the Estimating lead, this role works closely with the pre-contracts team to collate and co-ordinate bids and contracts from each division to formulate into a ‘blue-chip’ quality bid proposals.  Depending upon your experience and character, this role will see you as a point of contact with their clients and therefore proven skills across client development will be a great asset. Your role will encompass some marketing with existing templates and initiatives, which you’ll be required to embrace.

Skills:
To be successful in the role your main duties and responsibilities include:
  • Assist with the development of tender proposals ensuring submissions are accurate and compliant;
  • Liaise with various departments across the division for the collation of information required for bid proposals;
  • Ensure all proposals are formatted and comply with company brand guidelines, client requirements and follow internal quality guidelines;
  • Assist with administrative duties including contracts admin and marketing support.
  You
   
  • Demonstrated Tender/Bid experience with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in resources or construction environment;
  • Knowledge of the resources and/or major construction environment is preferred, however, this is a non – technical role;
  • Enjoy direct engagement with clients; Passionate and personable;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication – Some marketing experience;
  • Able to work within a small team in a service contractor environment – Not client-side or owners team;
  • Able to travel 25 minutes East of the Perth CBD day to day;
  • Must be able to complete an initial pre-qualification inc reference check, criminal records disclosure, OHS check and right to work in Australia.
    
**     There will be an immediate interview for the right person  **


What next:
To submit your details by clicking on the  APPLY button below.

Otherwise please feel free to call Paul  directly for an initial chat on
                               08 92156200  - Quote ref: Bid-955123

BulletPoints.BulletPoint: Bid co-ordination, client engagement and marketing - Industrial environment
Growing business; Backed by a resources industry giant.
Engaging and open work place; high staff retention.

Job.Title: Excavator / Bobcat Operator
Job.Summary: Seeking an experienced Excavator Operator for Perth Metro work. Early start in 2020
Job.Description:
Our client provides earth-moving services for civil and state / government projects. Ranging from construction of buildings to simple sand-moving or cleanup. They are currently seeking experienced Excavator Operators to join their ever growing team.
 
As a Excavator or/and Bobcat Operator, you will have at least 3 years experience operating all types of Production Excavators or mini excavators.
 
Requirements:
  • White Card
  • Open HR Truck License
  • Competence ticket
You will also need to hold any appropriate Nationally Accredited High Risk licences.
 
Successful candidates will be required to pass a full pre-employment medical including a drug and alcohol screen, have a proven ability to adhere to safety regulations and previous industry experience.
 
If you are interested in this opportunity, or would like to express your interest for future opportunities, please contact Crest by applying to the job.

Job.Title: Process Engineer | Plant operations and development | Perth
Job.Summary: Do you have '2020 vision' ? Then move to a progressive and engaging company who value your input and expertise. #gold #processing
Job.Description:
About the company

Crest is working with an established contractor to secure a 'proven and highly regarded' Process Engineer to add to their Perth based team. Our client is making great strides in 2020, and have recently been awarded contracts to further develop existing plants, as well as having many other mine site operational contracts in hand across WA.
 
About the role

Reporting directly to the Operations Manager, our client is looking for a passionate and highly personable Process Engineer with the ability and willingness to engage with clients to further develop plant production and maximise the companies brand specifically across mineral processing and maintenance contracts.

Duties:

  • To lead and manage all process-related technical optimisations, evaluations and reporting across plant production and plant development – Green & Brownfield;
  • Engaging with clients and preparing meetings with vendors and external stakeholders;
  • Generation of all relevant process documentation, laboratory test work flowsheet, plant layout and interaction with other disciplines;
  • Able assisting with bids and estimating across your specialist field.
  • Communicate with key stakeholders; Be open to change and flexible.
    
Skills and required:
  
  • Be the ‘go-to’ expert across metallurgy and process engineering of ideally gold or similar precious metals. Note: We are NOT looking mineral sands candidates for this position;
  • To be successful you have a degree in Process Engineering or Metallurgy with a depth of experience within processing operations and developing ‘bigger picture’ strategies; Gold experience will be held in high regard;
  • Comfortable working within a small team and be open to change - Flexible in the workplace;
  • This is a Perth based role near the airport – Some ad-hoc travel will be required.

Culture

This company prides itself on its retention of staff and its open-door policy. You will be supported to develop your side of the business and to personally grow within the organisation. An establish medium-sized business that is part-owned by a mining industry giant – Cash positive.

Next step:

Please apply with your CV (Ideally in WORD format) Note, your details are held in strict confidence.

Shortlisting has commenced.

Feel free to call Paul on +61 8 92156200 for an initial chat. 
Quote: Process  952761

BulletPoints.BulletPoint: Lead and develop our clients capability within the contractor space
Plant operations and project development - Precious metals

Job.Title: Steel Fixers / Concrete Patchers
Job.Summary: Concrete Patchers and Steel Fixers required for Precast Concrete Yard.
Job.Description:
We currently require experienced Steel Fixers and concrete patchers for our Precast Concrete client. This position will commence on casual but has the opportunity to become ongoing.

Basic Responsibilities:
• Steel Fixing of reo mesh
• Forming concrete moulds
• Inserting hardware
• Concrete patching
• Concrete finishing

Requirements:
• Previous experience working in a precast yard (highly desirable)
• Drivers Licence and reliable transport
• Ability to pass a Drug & Alcohol test
• White Card
• Available for an immediate start

If you are interested in the position and can meet the above requirements please select "Apply Now" below to send through your resume.


Only suitable candidates will be contacted

Job.Title: Estimator | Heavy fabrication & installation | WA
Job.Description:
The company
A highly regarded and long-established steel fabrication and construction services company to the construction, mining, oil and gas sectors - Australia wide.
  
About the role and you
Reviewing tender documentation to determine scope and specific terms and conditions, whilst ensuring accurate estimates of the total cost of projects are completed on time and in accordance with required technical standards. Working to the quality management system procedures and work instructions
  
  
The ideal candidate will have:
  
  • Trade certificate or Project Management/Engineering/Design background;
  • A high level of competence in all technical aspects of estimating;
  • An ability to prioritise workload and meet deadlines with a consistently high level of accuracy;
  • A demonstrated ability to develop practical solutions to problems;
  • Experience working within the heavy industrial fabrication & SMP industries;
  • 5 years or more experience in Construction / SMP Estimation;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Programs with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel;
  • A demonstrated understanding of Estimating core processes, requiring minimal direction and supervision.
  
  
The following additional skills and experience would be advantageous:
  
  • Have worked ‘onsite’ across Green & Brownfield project in Australia, either as a tradesman or Engineer:
  • Have proven success in the pricing of variation claims – Hard dollar contracts
  • Have a strong ability to identify direct and indirect cost estimates
  • Scheduling ability with Microsoft Project
  • Familiar with a Tier 2/3 contracting environment
  
Culture
This company has some of the best heavy industrial personnel in the state. The role will see you working along these professionals to deliver large scale projects to some of Australia's iconic projects. They have a positive uplift in workload for 2020
  
  
Please submit your details via the ‘Apply’ button  (Ideally in WORD)

BulletPoints.BulletPoint: First principle estimating - Hard dollar contracts
